strings:
<se_low>Yangus: Now we've said we'll do this bodyguard thing,
I s'pose we better stop chattin' an' 'ead over to the Dragon Graveyard.
<se_low>Yangus: I know we've got our own stuff to be gettin' on wiv, but we said we'd do it, so that's wot we've gotta do.
<se_high>Jessica: Cash must really be in a hurry if he took off for the Dragon Graveyard all on his own.

<se_high>Jessica: Then again, it's not that surprising.
We did have a late start, after all.

<se_def>Angelo: Fighting over who inherits the business!
It just goes to show that family ties count for nothing.<page>Angelo: The only thing siblings are likely to share is blood.
<se_high>Jessica: Speak for yourself! I'll always treasure the time I got to spend with my brother.

<se_def>Angelo: Ah, Jessica.
You're so young and naive.

<se_def>Angelo: You were lucky, Jessica, that's all.
Siblings don't always get on like you and your brother did, you know.
<se_def>Angelo: If we have to go through with this bodyguard business, I must say I'd rather have ‘guarded’ Carrie's body.
<se_def>Angelo: But I suppose there's not much point speaking up now.

<se_low>Yangus: Now we've said we'll do this bodyguard thing,
I s'pose we better stop chattin' an' 'ead over to the Dragon Graveyard.
<se_low>Yangus: I know we've got our own stuff to be gettin' on wiv, but we said we'd do it, so that's wot we've gotta do.
<se_high>Jessica: Carrie must really be in a hurry if she took off for the Dragon Graveyard all on her own.

<se_high>Jessica: Then again, it's not that surprising.
We did have a late start, after all.
<se_def>Angelo: Fighting over who inherits the business! It just goes to show that family ties count for nothing.<page>Angelo: The only thing siblings are likely to share is blood.
<se_high>Jessica: Speak for yourself! I'll always treasure the time I got to spend with my brother.

<se_def>Angelo: Ah, Jessica.
You're so young and naive.
<se_def>Angelo: You were lucky, Jessica, that's all. Siblings don't always get on like you and your brother did, you know.

<se_def>Angelo: I wonder if Carrie's all right.
She's jumped the gun a bit going to the Dragon Graveyard on her own.

<se_def>Angelo: Without us there, she can't go inside anyway.
She might as well have waited for us to escort her.

<se_low>King Trode: Now that you've taken on this role as a bodyguard, it won't do to have the ones you're supposed to be protecting perish.<page>King Trode: We must hurry to the Dragon Graveyard if that's where they are!
<se_low>Yangus: We've gotta 'urry an' 'elp Cash 'n' Carrie!
<se_low>Yangus: They're still laid out inside that maze o' bones. They could die or somefin' if we just leave 'em there.
<se_low>Yangus: An' then 'ow would we get our pay, eh?

<se_high>Jessica: Let's get Cash and Carrie out of this mess!
There's still time to save them!
<se_high>Jessica: We can't let them die! The world would be far too quiet without their ceaseless bickering.
<se_def>Angelo: Whatever else we feel we have to do at the moment, we really ought to go to the Dragon Graveyard. Those two might die otherwise.
<se_def>Angelo: The contest, or whatever that nonsense was, doesn't matter now.

<se_def>Angelo: We've got to help both of them.
I know we agreed to be Cash's bodyguards,
but we can't ignore Carrie. She's in danger too.

<se_low>King Trode: Now that you've taken on this role as a bodyguard, it won't do to have the ones you're supposed to be protecting perish.<page>King Trode: We must hurry to the Dragon Graveyard if that's where they are!
<se_low>Yangus: We've gotta 'urry an' 'elp Cash 'n' Carrie!
<se_low>Yangus: They're still laid out inside that maze o' bones. They could die or somefin' if we just leave 'em there.
<se_low>Yangus: An' then 'ow would we get our pay, eh?

<se_high>Jessica: Let's get Cash and Carrie out of this mess!
There's still time to save them!
<se_high>Jessica: We can't let them die! The world would be far too quiet without their ceaseless bickering.
<se_def>Angelo: Whatever else we feel we have to do at the moment, we really ought to go to the Dragon Graveyard. Those two might die otherwise.
<se_def>Angelo: The contest, or whatever that nonsense was, doesn't matter now.
<se_def>Angelo: We've got to help both of them. I know we agreed to be Carrie's bodyguards, but we can't ignore Cash. He's in danger too.
<se_low>Yangus: Wivout us there to 'elp 'em, Cash an' Carrie could be in real trouble at that Dragon Graveyard. Both of 'em could've been killed or somefin'!
<se_high>Jessica: If they were to die in there, the casino would fall into the hands of some total stranger.
<se_def>Angelo: Better all round, if you ask me. I can't think of anything more annoying than the casino closing down every time those two have a fight.
<se_high>Jessica: ‘Better all round’? Nice, Angelo. Really nice. How very cool and detached you are...just like your brother!
<se_def>Angelo: Oh, put a sock in it!
<se_low>Yangus: It's thanks to us that the casino's open again, eh?

<se_low>Yangus: Not that any o' the gamblers know it, mind.
It's 'ard bein' the unsung 'eroes doin' all the work behind the scenes, ain't it?
<se_high>Jessica: Well, I'm just glad that little family spat of theirs didn't lead to open war!

<se_high>Jessica: Now we can get back to business:
finding Dhoulmagus and making him pay for what he's done.
<se_def>Angelo: Now we can bet the shirt off Jessica's back on some thrillingly high risk fun! Goddess, what did we do before the casino reopened!?

<se_def>Angelo: I'd say we've opened up a rather convenient stop-off for a bit of relaxation.
We should make good use of it.
<se_low>Yangus: Did you come 'ere to Baccarat just to see if the casino was open, guv?

<se_low>Yangus: Wot!?
So you just came 'ere for a bit o' gamblin', then?

<se_def>Angelo: I'm surprised at you, <hero>, caring more about the casino than Jessica!
How unusually cool of you!
<se_low>Yangus: So you came to see if ya could get a lead on Jessica then, I s'pose?

<se_low>Yangus: Cor, anyone'd be lucky to 'ave you as a friend!
Always thinkin' of yer mates, intcha?

<se_low>Yangus: Cor, anyone'd be lucky to 'ave you as a friend!
Always thinkin' of yer mates, intcha?
<se_low>Yangus: Thinkin' about it, there ain't no way Jessica could've come 'ere to Baccarat to 'ave a flutter at the casino.
<se_low>Yangus: I mean, for starters, it's been shut for ages.
<se_def>Angelo: It's just a hunch, but I don't feel like we're going to find Jessica in any of the places we've visited so far.
<se_def>Angelo: Like I said, it's just a hunch, so don't ask me why I think it. I just do.

<se_low>Yangus: That's Golding's son an' daughter then, is it?
Didn't someone say they was adopted though?
<se_high>Jessica: You know, it's hard to tell what's really going through their heads. It's like they always say: ‘Love and hate are opposite sides of the same coin!’
<se_high>Jessica: But there's one thing I know for sure. Alistair and I weren't anything like Cash and Carrie.
<se_def>Angelo: Please! Don't tell me the casino's closed because of that petty little quarrel over the inheritance!

<se_low>Yangus: The casino's still shut.<page>Yangus: How d'ya s'pose all the workers are doin' for dough while the place ain't makin' no cash, eh?
Life must be 'ard for 'em.
<se_high>Jessica: The casino is shut down, so the people here aren't able to earn a living or have any fun.<page>Jessica: It really reminds me that Dhoulmagus passed through here.
<se_high>Jessica: He's ancient history as far as I'm concerned, though.
<se_def>Angelo: So you're itching to sample the delights of gambling in this fine casino are you <hero>?
<se_def>Angelo: Well you'd better go to the owner's home and ask for it to be reopened then!
<se_def>Angelo: Ah ha ha! Really? No interest? Well for my part, I wouldn't mind placing a few bets.
<se_low>Yangus: If we 'elp Cash OR Carrie, either way it's gonna mean gettin' distracted from wot we're doin', ain't it?
<se_low>Yangus: The pay sounds good an' ev'ryfin', but we don't wanna get tied up in this bodyguard stuff too long.
<se_high>Jessica: There's nothing worse than a fight between a brother and sister. Believe me, this isn't going to end until one of them is declared the winner.
<se_high>Jessica: That said, whenever Alistair and I fought, he'd always apologise right away if I started crying.
<se_high>Jessica: I don't have any particular problem with Carrie, but Cash is definitely more my type.
<se_low>Yangus: I don't care either way, meself.

<se_def>Angelo: Carrie's got my vote, hands down.
You're with me, right, <hero>?

<se_def>Angelo: That's it. A true knight, just like me.
A chivalrous man always protects a lady.

<se_high>Jessica: A true knight!? Give me a break.
You just like women, that's all!

<se_def>Angelo: You're not seriously trying to tell me that
Cash is more your type?
...Hmph! Each to their own.
<se_def>Angelo: So the casino won't be reopened unless we help one or the other of these kids?

<se_def>Angelo: Then I'd say we ought to do it.
Gamblers the world over will thank us for it.

<se_low>Yangus: Bettin' on which monster's gonna win,
that's more my kinda thing.
<se_low>Yangus: It's a bit more int'restin' than slot machines an' roulette, ain't it?
<se_high>Jessica: I don't know. Making monsters fight for the sake of entertainment doesn't sit right with me.
<se_def>Angelo: I wonder where they got all the monsters from in the first place.
<se_def>Angelo: There's no way they could've caught them all one by one.
<se_def>Angelo: Surely the monsters don't just turn up on the doorstep and ask to fight...do they!?

<se_low>Yangus: Cor! This ain't nuffin' like Pickham's casino!
Look at the decor!

<se_high>Jessica: Don't go too crazy, guys.
Do I need to remind everyone that we've got bigger fish to fry?

<se_high>Jessica: Wow, just listen to me!
I'm starting to sound like everyone's mother!<page>Jessica: I guess my role during this journey is making sure you boys don't get sidetracked.
<se_def>Angelo: Hey! What's the deal!? This is serious!

<se_def>Angelo: There's no poker here!
Poker's my game!
<se_def>Angelo: ...Oh, well. It's a shame, but I can put my hand to any game in here. Let's have some fun!

<se_def>Angelo: Lady Luck's a friend of mine!
We have a little arrangement, you know,
and I never lose!
<se_low>Yangus: If we 'elp Cash OR Carrie, either way it's gonna mean gettin' distracted from wot we're doin', ain't it?
<se_low>Yangus: The pay sounds good an' ev'ryfin', but we don't wanna get tied up in this bodyguard stuff too long.
<se_high>Jessica: There's nothing worse than a fight between a brother and sister. Believe me, this isn't going to end until one of them is declared the winner.
<se_high>Jessica: That said, whenever Alistair and I fought, he'd always apologise right away if I started crying.
<se_def>Angelo: So the casino won't be reopened unless we help one or the other of these kids?

<se_def>Angelo: Then I'd say we ought to do it.
Gamblers the world over will thank us for it.
<se_low>Yangus: Sweet!

<se_low>Yangus: Casino tokens!
For nuffin'!
Time to 'it the tables!

<se_low>Yangus: Hang on...
Nah, it weren't for free, was it?
We bust a gut to earn them tokens.
<se_high>Jessica: I know these tokens are our reward and everything, but I just can't get excited over them.
<se_high>Jessica: By the time we use them up, we're probably going to be hopelessly addicted to gambling.<page>Jessica: Before you know it, we'll be shelling out for our own tokens!

<se_high>Jessica: So it's tough for me to see this as a ‘payment’.
If we get hooked, they'll be the ones turning a profit from us!
<se_def>Angelo: Allow me, <hero>. I'll double those tokens. No, I'll even triple them.
<se_def>Angelo: You know about my poker prowess, don't you?
<se_def>Angelo: I wonder if they have poker at the Baccarat casino.
<se_low>Yangus: I don't remember goin' to sleep last night.
<se_low>Yangus: I do remember we 'ad a good bit o' grub in the evenin' though. I wouldn't mind a repeat performance.
<se_high>Jessica: I can't believe she tried to sabotage us by putting sleeping powder in our food!
<se_high>Jessica: She may have a cute face, but she's acting like a total monster.
<se_def>Angelo: Aaah, I'm still tired now...
<se_def>Angelo: At least the sleeping powder in the food last night explains why I couldn't stay awake.
<se_low>Yangus: I don't remember goin' to sleep last night.

<se_low>Yangus: I do remember we 'ad a good bit o' grub in the evenin' though.
I wouldn't mind a repeat performance!
<se_high>Jessica: I can't believe he tried to sabotage us by putting sleeping powder in our food!
<se_high>Jessica: You know, I used to think Cash was kind of cute, but now I take it back!

<se_def>Angelo: Aaah, I'm still tired now...
But there's no time for a nap.
We've got to get after Carrie.
<se_def>Angelo: We can't let a good-looking girl like that go all that way on her own!
<se_low>Yangus: Hah! That feast last night was great! An' we're gonna get paid when we're done an' all! Sounds like a good deal to me!
<se_low>Yangus: Sweet!

<se_low>Yangus: Casino tokens!
For nuffin'!
Time to 'it the tables!

<se_low>Yangus: Hang on...
Nah, it weren't for free, was it?
We bust a gut to earn them tokens.
<se_high>Jessica: To tell you the truth, I was worried Cash and Carrie were going to start fighting all over again!
<se_high>Jessica: I know these tokens are our reward and everything, but I just can't get excited over them.
<se_high>Jessica: By the time we use them up, we're probably going to be hopelessly addicted to gambling.<page>Jessica: Before you know it, we'll be shelling out for our own tokens!

<se_high>Jessica: So it's tough for me to see this as a ‘payment’.
If we get hooked, they'll be the ones turning a profit from us!
<se_def>Angelo: Now we can finally wash our hands of this affair. Just as soon as we've collected our compensation, of course!
<se_def>Angelo: Allow me, <hero>. I'll double those tokens. No, I'll even triple them.
<se_def>Angelo: You know about my poker prowess, don't you?
<se_def>Angelo: I wonder if they have poker at the Baccarat casino.

<se_low>Yangus: The Baccarat casino's a whopper compared to the one in Pickham.
An' it's got more diff'rent games, an' all.
<se_low>Yangus: If wot we 'eard at the church is right, we've gotta search the town from 'ead to toe and flush that Dhoulmagus out!

<se_low>Yangus: We can't leave no stone unturned!
No cupboard unopened!
No barrel unsmashed!
<se_high>Jessica: If looks are any indication, Yangus, I'd say gambling is your forte.

<se_def>Angelo: I couldn't agree more.
You've got trickster written all over your face.
<se_low>Yangus: I ain't good at that kind o' thing. Too much detail. I always get taken to the cleaners by me mates whenever there's a bet on.
<se_high>Jessica: You don't look particularly upset about it, though!
<se_high>Jessica: Even a country girl like me has heard of this town.
<se_high>Jessica: Baccarat and its casino are famous all over the world.

<se_high>Jessica: It's crystal clear to me now.
Dhoulmagus has only one thing on his mind.
Murder.

<se_high>Jessica: We've got to get one step ahead!
We have to identify his next target as soon as possible and protect them!
<se_high>Jessica: As far as I'm concerned, saving lives is just as important as getting my revenge.
<se_def>Angelo: If Dhoulmagus got here before us, chances are his next target's already dead.
<se_def>Angelo: If Dhoulmagus was here, and recently, it means we're finally catching up with him.
<se_def>Angelo: Even if he's left town already, we should be able to pick up some clues about where he went if we ask around.
<se_def>Angelo: Looks like I'll be able to take revenge for the Abbot's death sooner than expected!
<se_low>Yangus: I really don't get this.
<se_low>Yangus: Wot would Dhoulmagus wanna kill the owner o' the casino for?

<se_high>Jessica: You know, I wonder what Dhoulmagus is like?
I mean, I know he's a bad guy, but what's he LIKE?
<se_low>Yangus: Yeah, it'd be a bit of a turn up for the books if 'e was actually a bloomin' good bloke, eh!?

<se_def>Angelo: Ha ha!
‘Laughing Killer Revealed to be “Good Bloke”!’
Very likely!
<se_def>Angelo: ‘When not busy murdering, Mr. Dhoulmagus spends his spare time working for charity.<page>Angelo: ‘He also regularly donates his ill-gotten gains to a number of worthy causes...’

<se_high>Jessica: Don't be ridiculous!
He's a cold-blooded killer.

<se_high>Jessica: There are people here grieving just like I am.
Because Dhoulmagus killed someone they loved.
<se_def>Angelo: So it looks like a posse was sent out to pursue Dhoulmagus. I have to say, I'm more worried about their safety than his.
<se_def>Angelo: We don't want any more victims in this bloody mess.
<se_low>Yangus: I was lookin' forward to 'avin' a bit of a break at the casino, but it's shut.
<se_high>Jessica: I wonder what the late owner of the casino looked like. Golding.
<se_def>Angelo: I imagine he was blessed with copious amounts of body hair, which he washed a maximum of once a week...and then styled with ear wax!
<se_high>Jessica: Yuck!
<se_def>Angelo: But equally the kind of man who wouldn't hesitate to save a drowning cat from a fast<->flowing river. In spite of his dislike of bathing.
<se_low>Yangus: Ya tryin' to tell me ya think Goldin' was a bit of an 'airy bloke who weren't too keen on washin'!?

<se_high>Jessica: Hey, <hero>.
I don't mean to nag, but we don't have time for wandering around aimlessly.
<se_high>Jessica: We've got to find that magic mirror right away.

<se_def>Angelo: My own father was a gambling man apparently.
And a real piece of dirt to go with it.
That's what my brother told me.
<se_def>Angelo: I wonder if he ever came here to the casino.
<se_low>Yangus: It's a shame Grandad and that Charmless bloke can't see eye to eye.

<se_low>Yangus: I actually feel a bit sorry for the old codger.
Bet you never thought you'd see the day!
<se_high>Jessica: I set off on this journey to avenge my brother's death, and yet here I am babysitting this creep!
<se_def>Angelo: Poor Princess Medea. Even if she's freed from this curse, she has to marry that awful Charmless.
<se_high>Jessica: If I were the Princess, I'd rather stay as a horse than marry that guy!
<se_low>Yangus: I've got it! We should find the Princess a nice 'orse-faced bloke wiv goofy teeth an' a long nose! It's the perfect solution!

<se_def>Angelo: How is that perfect!?
A horse can't marry a human, you idiot!
<se_def>Angelo: Ah, it's good to get away from Charmless for a while.
<se_def>Angelo: He's always lording it over us! How's a man supposed to relax in these conditions!?
<se_low>Yangus: Well that was a bleedin' nightmare! Who'd 'ave thought that 'angin' out wiv royals would be this much of a pain!?
<se_high>Jessica: Once we've got the magic mirror from Argonia, we can finally get back to concentrating on Dhoulmagus again.

<se_def>Angelo: What a prize ass that Charmless is,
getting on Medea's back like that!
Imagine if he knew she was his fiancée!
<se_def>Angelo: I suppose it's fair enough that he doesn't realise, though. A man doesn't expect his future bride to turn up in a bridle!
<se_low>Yangus: I wonder when this casino's gonna open up again.
<se_low>Yangus: I reckon it'd be better for the town if they just came out an' said old Golding 'ad snuffed it an' got them doors open again.

<se_high>Jessica: I feel bad for Golding's children.
Losing their only parent like that...
<se_high>Jessica: We've got to find Dhoulmagus before he strikes again. He's caused enough tragedy already.
<se_def>Angelo: Why would Dhoulmagus kill the owner of a casino? I can't fathom his motives. Maybe he has an ethical objection to gambling?
<se_high>Jessica: Maybe he lost everything at roulette and went after Golding to clear his debt?
<se_low>Yangus: That'd make 'im no different from a common crook. Trust me, I'd know!
<se_def>Angelo: It seems the townspeople don't know the truth yet.

<se_def>Angelo: You know, about Golding.
The people who were at the Dark Ruins to avenge his death said so, didn't they?

<se_low>Yangus: Let's get this out of the way sharpish, eh.
We don't 'ave time to faff about.
<se_low>Yangus: We ain't goin' 'ome 'til we've given Dhoulmagus the wot-for in the Dark Ruins, so we'll just 'ave to do wot it takes to get at 'im.
<se_high>Jessica: Angelo, are you going to leave the Templars when we've defeated Dhoulmagus?
<se_def>Angelo: That's the plan. I don't want to be around my brother any more for one thing.
<se_def>Angelo: And the Abbot was my only real friend at the abbey. Once I've avenged his death, I won't have any more ties with the place.

<se_low>Yangus: Why d'you 'ate your brother so much, eh?
You've only got the one, after all.
Shouldn't you 'ave a bash at gettin' on?

<se_def>Angelo: It's him who hates me.
I don't have any feelings for him at all...
None whatsoever.

<se_high>Jessica: Let's hurry up back to the Dark Ruins.
Hopefully that mirror we spent so much effort getting hold of will take us to Dhoulmagus at last.

<se_def>Angelo: When we got the magic mirror in Argonia,
I thought we were just a breath away from defeating Dhoulmagus.

<se_def>Angelo: But this should be the end of the distractions.
Now it's time to finish him off once and for all!
<se_low>Yangus: I'm well pleased that I could take you an' the old codger to Pickham on our travels!

<se_low>Yangus: I don't get why Angelo didn't take to the place.
Such a pity! Ha ha ha!
<se_high>Jessica: If Alistair lost to this guy, we should be ready for a tough fight!
<se_high>Jessica: We should make sure we're properly prepared before we go back to the Dark Ruins.
<se_def>Angelo: Jessica's a bit strange when you think about it. She's supposed to be a lady and yet here she is, hunting down her brother's killer!
<se_low>Yangus: She may be a lady by name, but she's from the sticks, ain't she? Just the same as the local yokels at the end o' the day!
<se_low>Yangus: Te he he he hee!

<se_high>Jessica: You've got a cheek talking about me like that!
And what's with the weird laugh anyway!?
<se_def>Angelo: I have to avenge the Abbot's death before I can properly draw a line under my life at the abbey.
<se_def>Angelo: When I first set off, I was under orders and nothing more. But now I feel like this is my own duty.

<se_low>Yangus: I was well narked to find the casino shut
the first time I come 'ere.
I'd been lookin' forward to a few games.
<se_low>Yangus: It was almost as bad as the time I found out a wallet I'd nicked only 'ad two measly gold coins in it!
<se_low>Yangus: Crikey! I've just remembered!
<se_low>Yangus: We was s'posed to be goin' to that Dragon Graveyard place to 'elp that Cash geezer.

<se_low>Yangus: ‘Duty and 'umanity’, that's my motto.
I just forgot the duty part this time...

<se_low>Yangus: I ain't too 'appy about still bein' 'ere.
I mean, it ain't manners to keep people waitin'.
An' I'm big on manners, I am.
<se_low>Yangus: Crikey! I've just remembered!
<se_low>Yangus: We was s'posed to be goin' to that Dragon Graveyard place to 'elp that Carrie girl.

<se_low>Yangus: ‘Duty and 'umanity’, that's my motto.
I just forgot the duty part this time...

<se_low>Yangus: I ain't too 'appy about still bein' 'ere.
I mean, it ain't manners to keep people waitin'.
An' I'm big on manners, I am.
<se_low>Yangus: We should go an' let our 'air down in the casino one more time before we go off an' fight Rhapthorne. Not that I've got that much to let down, but still...
<se_low>Yangus: Wiv a bit o' luck, we might win a decent stack o' tokens. Then we can go off into battle knowin' we've got a bit o' good fortune on our side.
<se_low>Yangus: A bit of a boost like that'll do us no end o' good. We'll make easy work of 'im!

<se_low>Yangus: Guv!
There's a king squid on the rampage in town!
<se_low>Yangus: It can't be good when there's monsters comin' inta town, eh? I doubt they're very relaxin' to 'ave around.
<se_low>Yangus: Bet this is all cos o' that Lord o' Darkness an' all.
<se_high>Jessica: Now that I think about it, Rhapthorne must be behind the murder of Golding, too.
<se_high>Jessica: At the time, I thought Dhoulmagus was just on a mindless killing spree.
<se_high>Jessica: I'm picturing Cash waiting for us all alone under the scorching desert sun...
<se_high>Jessica: Oooh...!
<se_high>Jessica: Wow! Now I feel guilty...
<se_high>Jessica: I'm picturing Carrie waiting for us all alone under the scorching desert sun...
<se_high>Jessica: Oooh...!
<se_high>Jessica: Wow! Now I feel guilty...
<se_high>Jessica: Seeing the casino up and running again makes me realise how much Cash and Carrie have grown up.
<se_high>Jessica: Is it just me, or does it look like the king squid and the townspeople are having fun in the water together?
<se_high>Jessica: I wonder if other towns and castles are having the same problem with monsters coming in?

<se_def>Angelo: I wouldn't be surprised.<page>Angelo: Ever since Rhapthorne was resurrected,
the monsters have been getting stronger and stronger. This could probably happen anywhere.
<se_low>Yangus: I bet it's 'im who's gettin' 'em all to go on the rampage.
<se_def>Angelo: No, I don't think so. He doesn't seem to have any followers. He's hardly the kind of guy you'd want to be around.
<se_high>Jessica: I wonder if that king squid was actually sent here by Rhapthorne? You know, like an assassin?
